articles.title: A timeline of Cathay Cineplexes as struggling cinema chain faces closure
articles.summary:
📰 싱가포르, 정부, 비즈니스 관련 뉴스
📝 It opened its doors to the public in October 1939 as Singapore’s first air-conditioned cinema.  The Business Times traces Cathay’s storied history:...
articles.content: It opened its doors to the public in October 1939 as Singapore’s first air-conditioned cinema. The Business Times traces Cathay’s storied history:. Malaysian business magnate Loke Wan Tho built up Cathay Organisation and established Cathay Cinema. The Cathay Building at 2 Handy Road was Singapore’s first skyscraper. 1942-1945: During the Japanese Occupation, it housed the Japanese broadcasting department, military propaganda department and military information bureau. February 1949: Associated Theatres regained control of the building after the government vacated it. Cathay opened Singapore’s first drive-in cinema in Jurong. 1999: Cathay Organisation listed on the Singapore Stock Exchange. It was later delisted in 2006. The move was part of cost rationalisation for its cinema operations, said mm2 Asia
